intro: Seddera conglomerata, commonly known as the clustered seddera, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pale pink or white, and they bloom in clusters during the winter months. Seddera conglomerata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
